sentences: Frank Lacy (born August 9, 1958, Houston, Texas) is an American jazz trombonist who has spent many years as a member of the Mingus Big Band.
In 1979, he went to the Berklee College of Music in Boston, studying trombone and composition.
Lacy moved to New York City in 1981.
In 1986, he played with Illinois Jacquet's big band, and a couple years later he was musical director for Art Blakey.
He released his first album as a band leader in 1991 with his father on guitar.
He has spent over twenty years as a member of the Mingus Big Band.
Live in Tokyo at the Blue Note (2006)With Lester Bowie
The Fire This Time (1992)With Roy Hargrove
South of the Border (DIW, 1992)With McCoy Tyner
Easily Slip Into Another World, Henry Threadgill (1987)
The Bones of Art, Steve Turre (2013)
